 49/// Namespace for low-level data access interfaces.  These interfaces
 50/// provide low-level data access to data stored within blocks
 51/// (directly or indirectly).
 52///
 53/// These interfaces are not intended to be used in application code,
 54/// or in the library implementation outside of the Ext_data class.
 55/// Not all low-level interfaces are valid for all blocks, and over time
 56/// details of the low-level interface may change.  To provide a
 57/// consistent data interface to all blocks, the Ext_data class should
 58/// be used instead.
 59namespace data_access 
 60{
 61
 62/// Low_level_data_access declared in extdata_common.hpp.
 63
 64/// Specializaitons for
 65///  - Direct_access_tag
 66///  - Copy_access_tag
 67/// are defined in core/extdata.hpp.
 68
 69
 70
 71/// Specialization for low-level reordered direct data access.
 72/// (Not implemented yet).
 73
 74/// Template parameters:
 75///   :Block: to be a block that supports direct access via member
 76///           functions impl_data() and impl_stride().  Access to these
 77///           members can be protected by making Low_level_data_access a friend
 78///           class to the block.
 79///   :LP:    is a layout policy describing the desired layout.  It is should
 80///           match the inherent layout of the block.  Specifying a layout
 81///           not directly supported by the block is an error and results in
 82///           undefined behavior.
 83template <typename Block,
 84	  typename LP>
 85class Low_level_data_access<Reorder_access_tag, Block, LP>
 86{
 87  // Compile time typedefs.
 88public:
 89  static dimension_type const dim = LP::dim;
 90
 91  typedef typename Block::value_type value_type;
 92  typedef typename LP::order_type    order_type;
 93  typedef typename LP::pack_type     pack_type;
 94  typedef typename LP::complex_type  complex_type;
 95
 96  typedef Storage<complex_type, value_type> storage_type;
 97  typedef typename storage_type::type raw_ptr_type;
 98
 99  // Compile- and run-time properties.
100public:
101  static int   const CT_Cost         = 1;
102  static bool  const CT_Mem_not_req  = true;
103  static bool  const CT_Xfer_not_req = false;
104
105  static int    cost         (Block const& /*block*/, LP const& /*layout*/)
106    { return CT_Cost; }
107  static size_t mem_required (Block const& /*block*/, LP const& /*layout*/)
108    { return 0; }
109  static size_t xfer_required(Block const& /*block*/, LP const& /*layout*/)
110    { return !CT_Xfer_not_req; }
111
112  // Constructor and destructor.
113public:
114  Low_level_data_access(Block&,
115		     raw_ptr_type     = NULL)
116  {
117    VSIP_IMPL_THROW(impl::unimplemented("Reorder_access_tag"));
118  }
119
120  ~Low_level_data_access() {}
121
122  void cleanup(Block*)
123  {
124    VSIP_IMPL_THROW(impl::unimplemented("Reorder_access_tag"));
125  }
126
127  // Direct data acessors.
128public:
129  value_type*	data  (Block* blk) const
130    { return blk->impl_data(); }
131  stride_type	stride(Block* blk, dimension_type d) const
132    { return blk->impl_stride(dim, d); }
133  length_type	size  (Block* blk, dimension_type d) const
134    { return blk->size(dim, d); }
135  length_type	size  (Block* blk) const
136    { return blk->size(); }
137};
138
139
140
141template <typename T>
142inline bool
143is_aligned_to(T* pointer, size_t align)
144{
145  return reinterpret_cast<size_t>(pointer) % align == 0;
146}
147
148template <typename T>
149inline bool
150is_aligned_to(std::pair<T*, T*> pointer, size_t align)
151{
152  return reinterpret_cast<size_t>(pointer.first)  % align == 0 &&
153         reinterpret_cast<size_t>(pointer.second) % align == 0;
154}
155
156
157/// Determine if direct access is OK at runtime for a given block.
158template <typename LP,
159	  typename BlockT>
160bool
161is_direct_ok(BlockT const& block)
162{
163  typedef typename BlockT::value_type                 value_type;
164  typedef typename Block_layout<BlockT>::complex_type complex_type;
165  typedef typename Block_layout<BlockT>::order_type   order_type;
166
167  dimension_type const dim0 = order_type::impl_dim0;
168  dimension_type const dim1 = order_type::impl_dim1;
169  dimension_type const dim2 = order_type::impl_dim2;
170
171  if (!Type_equal<complex_type, typename LP::complex_type>::value ||
172      !Type_equal<order_type, typename LP::order_type>::value)
173    return false;
174  else if (Type_equal<typename LP::pack_type, Stride_unit>::value)
175  {
176    if (LP::dim == 1)
177      return block.impl_stride(1, 0) == 1;
178    else if (LP::dim == 2)
179      return block.impl_stride(2, dim1) == 1;
180    else /* if (LP::dim == 3) */
181      return block.impl_stride(3, dim2) == 1;
182  }
183  else if (Type_equal<typename LP::pack_type, Stride_unit_dense>::value)
184  {
185    if (LP::dim == 1)
186      return block.impl_stride(1, 0) == 1;
187    else if (LP::dim == 2)
188      return    block.impl_stride(2, dim1) == 1
189	     && (   block.impl_stride(2, dim0) ==
190		       static_cast<stride_type>(block.size(2, dim1))
191		 || block.size(2, dim0) == 1);
192    else /* if (LP::dim == 3) */
193    {
194
195      bool ok2 = (block.impl_stride(3, dim2) == 1);
196      bool ok1 = (block.impl_stride(3, dim1) ==
197		  static_cast<stride_type>(block.size(3, dim2)))
198	|| (block.size(3, dim1) == 1 && block.size(3, dim0) == 1);
199      bool ok0 = (block.impl_stride(3, dim0) ==
200		  static_cast<stride_type>(block.size(3, dim1) *
201					   block.size(3, dim2)))
202	|| block.size(3, dim0) == 1;
203
204      return ok0 && ok1 && ok2;
205    }
206  }
207  else if (Is_stride_unit_align<typename LP::pack_type>::value)
208  {
209    unsigned align = Is_stride_unit_align<typename LP::pack_type>::align;
210
211    if (!is_aligned_to(block.impl_data(), align))
212      return false;
213
214    if (LP::dim == 1)
215      return block.impl_stride(1, 0) == 1;
216    else if (LP::dim == 2)
217      return block.impl_stride(2, dim1) == 1 &&
218	((block.impl_stride(2, dim0) * sizeof(value_type)) % align == 0);
219    else /* if (LP::dim == 3) */
220      return 
221	block.impl_stride(3, dim2) == 1 &&
222	(block.impl_stride(3, dim1) * sizeof(value_type)) % align == 0 &&
223	(block.impl_stride(3, dim0) * sizeof(value_type)) % align == 0;
224  }
225  else /* if (Type_equal<typename LP::pack_type, Stride_unknown>::value) */
226  {
227    assert((Type_equal<typename LP::pack_type, Stride_unknown>::value));
228    return true;
229  }
230}
231
232
233
234/// Specialization for flexible (direct or copied, depending on
235/// stride) direct data access.
236///
237/// Template parameter:
238///   :Block: to be a block.
239///   :LP:    is a layout policy describing the desired layout.
240///           The desired layout can be different from the block's layout.
241///
242/// Notes:
243///   When the desired layout packing format is either Stride_unit or
244///   Stride_unknown, the packing format used will be Stride_unit_dense.
245template <typename Block,
246	  typename LP>
247class Low_level_data_access<Flexible_access_tag, Block, LP>
248{
249  // Compile time typedefs.
250public:
251  static dimension_type const dim = LP::dim;
252
253  typedef typename Block::value_type value_type;
254  typedef typename LP::order_type    order_type;
255  typedef typename
256          ITE_Type<Type_equal<typename LP::pack_type, Stride_unit>::value ||
257	           Type_equal<typename LP::pack_type, Stride_unknown>::value,
258                   As_type<Stride_unit_dense>,
259		   As_type<typename LP::pack_type> >::type pack_type;
260  typedef typename LP::complex_type  complex_type;
261
262  typedef Layout<dim, order_type, pack_type, complex_type> actual_layout_type;
263
264  typedef Allocated_storage<complex_type, value_type> storage_type;
265  typedef typename storage_type::type                 raw_ptr_type;
266  typedef typename storage_type::const_type           const_raw_ptr_type;
267
268  // Compile- and run-time properties.
269public:
270  static int   const CT_Cost          = 2;
271  static bool  const CT_Mem_not_req   = false;
272  static bool  const CT_Xfer_not_req  = false;
273
274  static int    cost         (Block const& block, LP const&)
275    { return is_direct_ok<LP>(block) ? 0 : 2; }
276  static size_t mem_required (Block const& block, LP const&)
277    { return is_direct_ok<LP>(block) ? 0 :
278	sizeof(typename Block::value_type) * block.size(); }
279  static size_t xfer_required(Block const& block, LP const&)
280    { return is_direct_ok<LP>(block) ? false : !CT_Xfer_not_req; }
281
282  // Constructor and destructor.
283public:
284  Low_level_data_access(Block&         blk,
285			raw_ptr_type   buffer = NULL)
286    : use_direct_(is_direct_ok<LP>(blk)),
287      layout_    (extent<dim>(blk)),
288      storage_   (use_direct_ ? 0 : layout_.total_size(), buffer)
289  {}
290
291  ~Low_level_data_access()
292    { storage_.deallocate(layout_.total_size()); }
293
294  void begin(Block* blk, bool sync)
295  {
296    if (!use_direct_ && sync)
297      Block_copy_to_ptr<LP::dim, Block, order_type, pack_type, complex_type>
298	::copy(blk, layout_, storage_.data());
299  }
300
301  void end(Block* blk, bool sync)
302  {
303    if (!use_direct_ && sync)
304      Block_copy_from_ptr<LP::dim, Block, order_type, pack_type, complex_type>
305	::copy(blk, layout_, storage_.data());
306  }
307
308  int cost() const { return use_direct_ ? 0 : 2; }
309
310  // Direct data acessors.
311public:
312  raw_ptr_type	data(Block* blk)
313    { return use_direct_ ? blk->impl_data() : storage_.data(); }
314  const_raw_ptr_type data(Block* blk) const
315    { return use_direct_ ? blk->impl_data() : storage_.data(); }
316  stride_type	stride(Block* blk, dimension_type d) const
317    { return use_direct_ ? blk->impl_stride(dim, d) : layout_.stride(d); }
318  length_type	size  (Block* blk, dimension_type d) const
319    { return use_direct_ ? blk->size(dim, d) : blk->size(Block::dim, d); }
320  length_type	size  (Block* blk) const
321    { return blk->size(); }
322
323  // Member data.
324private:
325  bool                               use_direct_;
326  Applied_layout<actual_layout_type> layout_;
327  storage_type                       storage_;
328};
329
330
331template <> struct Cost<Reorder_access_tag>  { static int const value = 1; };
332template <> struct Cost<Flexible_access_tag> { static int const value = 2; };
333
334} // namespace vsip::impl::data_access
335
336
337
338/// Class describing access type demotion.
339template <typename AccessTag>
340struct Access_demotion;
341
342template <>
343struct Access_demotion<Direct_access_tag>
344{
345  typedef Direct_access_tag  direct_type;
346
347  typedef Copy_access_tag     reorder_type;
348  typedef Flexible_access_tag flex_type;
349  typedef Copy_access_tag     copy_type;
350  typedef Bogus_access_tag    bogus_type;
351};
352
353template <>
354struct Access_demotion<Reorder_access_tag>
355{
356  typedef Reorder_access_tag direct_type;
357  typedef Reorder_access_tag reorder_type;
358  typedef Copy_access_tag    flex_type;
359  typedef Copy_access_tag    copy_type;
360  typedef Bogus_access_tag   bogus_type;
361};
362
363template <>
364struct Access_demotion<Copy_access_tag>
365{
366  typedef Copy_access_tag    direct_type;
367  typedef Copy_access_tag    reorder_type;
368  typedef Copy_access_tag    flex_type;
369  typedef Copy_access_tag    copy_type;
370  typedef Bogus_access_tag   bogus_type;
371};
372
373
374
375/// Choose access type for a given block and desired layout.
376template <typename Block,
377	  typename LP>
378struct Choose_access
379{
380  typedef typename Block_layout<Block>::access_type access_type;
381  typedef Access_demotion<access_type>              demotion_type;
382
383  typedef
384  choose_access::CA_General<demotion_type,
385	     typename Block_layout<Block>::order_type,
386	     typename Block_layout<Block>::pack_type,
387	     typename Block_layout<Block>::complex_type,
388             typename LP::order_type,
389             typename LP::pack_type,
390	     typename LP::complex_type> ca_type;
391
392  typedef typename ca_type::type type;
393  typedef typename ca_type::reason_type reason_type;
394};
395
396} // namespace vsip::impl
